title: Effect of Oral EGb761® on Brain Glucose Metabolism in Three Groups of Elderly With Memory Complaint, Mild Alzheimer's Disease, and Cognitively Normal Elderly. Phase II, Randomised, Double-blind, Parallel Groups, Placebo-controlled Study
description_brief: The aim of the study is to evaluate the effect of EGb761®, in comparison to placebo, on cerebral glucose metabolism, in three groups of elderly patients: newly diagnosed mild Alzheimer's disease (AD), memory complaint patients with cognitive impairment (MC) and memory complaint patients cognitively normal (CNE). The first phase includes four weeks treatment with EGb761® for all groups, with change in brain glucose metabolism at month 1 using 18 FDG-PET, as primary endpoint which will be followed by an open 17 months follow-up (FU) period with EGb761® treatment in MC and CNE patients.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails:
A total of 63 participants were screened of which 49 subjects were randomised to either EGb761 and Placebo treatment groups (double-blind period).

The 49 randomised subjects consisted of three groups of elderly subjects: Cognitively normal elderly (CNE), Memory Complaint (MC) and Alzheimer's Disease (AD).

groups.title: EGb761 120 mg
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 4 weeks (Double-blind phase) for CNE, MC, and AD patients and 17 months (Open phase) for CNE and MC patients

groups.title: Placebo
groups.description: Placebo 1 tablet twice a day for 4 weeks CNE, MC, and AD patients

achievements.comment: Open period was treated with EGB761®. 41 subjects accepted follow-up open period(21 in CNE,20 in MC)
This was an open period, without placebo arm, the number of subject on placebo is 0.
Open period was not proposed to AD subjects.

groups.title: EGb761 120 mg
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 4 weeks (Double-blind phase) for CNE, MC, and AD patients and 17 months (Open phase) for CNE and MC patients

groups.title: Placebo
groups.description: Placebo 1 tablet twice a day for 4 weeks CNE, MC, and AD patients

groups.title: Total
groups.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Brain Glucose Metabolism in the MC and CNE Groups
outcomeMeasures.description:
Brain glucose metabolism measured by 18FDG PET

SUVBSA2 = \[Brain radioactivity (Bq/cc)\] / \[Injected dose (MBq)/BSA2\] x \[Blood glucose (g/l)\]

BSA2(m\^2) = 0.007184 x Height (cm)\^0.35 x weight (kg)\^0.80
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment.

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - CNE)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for CNE patients

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - MC)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg 17 months (open phase) for MC patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Cognitive Tests-Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR) Score in MC and CNE Groups
outcomeMeasures.description: CDR is a structured interview to collect information regarding subject's memory in a standard way from both the patient and the helper. Scores are calculated using below scale; q CDR=No dementia (score: 0), q CDR=Very mild dementia (score: 0.5), q CDR=Mild dementia (score: 1), q CDR=Moderate dementia (score: 2) and q CDR=Severe dementia (score: 3).
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment.

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - CNE)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for CNE patients

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - MC)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for MC patient

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Cognitive Tests-Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS) Score in MC and CNE Groups
outcomeMeasures.description: The Geriatric Depression Scale is a self-administered depression scale, which was developed as a basic screening measure for depression in older adults. By "yes" or "no" answers, scores permit to classify patients into groups of "severely depressed" (score of 21 to 30), "moderately depressed" (score of 11 to 20) and "normal" (score of 0 to10). It takes10 to 15 minutes to administer.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment.

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - CNE)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for CNE patients

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - MC)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for MC patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Cognitive Tests-Verbal Fluency in MC and CNE Groups
outcomeMeasures.description:
Subjects completed a verbal fluency test. Higher scores represent higher levels of verbal fluency. Minimum score=0 and Maximum score= N/A.

Letter fluency: this task consists of enouncing as many words as possible that begin with a given letter of the alphabet. Participants are not allowed to use proper names.

Categorical fluency: in this task participants are asked to list as many words as possible that belong to a given semantic category (e.g. animals, fruits, towns) Each condition foresees 60 sec of word generation time. The score corresponds to the number of words correctly given. The verbal fluency task measures semantic storage and executive retrieval functions.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment.

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - CNE)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for CNE patients

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - MC)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for MC patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Brain Glucose Metabolism Measured Using 18-Fluorodeoxyglucose Positron Emission Tomography (18FDG-PET)
outcomeMeasures.description:
Following statistical parametric mapping (SPM) analyses were performed by the Commissariat à l'Energie Atomique (CEA):

* The comparison between treatment groups separately for each group of elderly subjects (CNE and MC groups only)
* The comparison between the two groups of elderly subjects (CNE and MC groups only) by treatment group

FDG PET demonstrates reductions in the cerebral glucose metabolism that may occur a few years before the overt clinical manifestation of disease.

SUVBSA2 = \[Brain radioactivity (Bq/cc)\] / \[Injected dose (MBq)/BSA2\] x \[Blood glucose (g/l)\]

BSA2(m\^2) = 0.007184 x Height (cm)\^0.35 x weight (kg)\^0.80

Standardized Uptake Value (SUV) Body Surface Area (BSA)
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Intention to treat (ITT) population: All treated CNE and MC patients
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: From Baseline (Month 0) to Week 4 (Month 1) - Double blind phase

groups.title: EGb761 120 mg (CNE)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 4 weeks (Double-blind phase) for CNE, MC, and AD patients

groups.description: Placebo 1 tablet twice a day for 4 weeks for CNE, MC and AD patients

groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 4 weeks (Double-blind phase) for CNE, MC, and AD patients

groups.title: Placebo (MC)
groups.description: Placebo 1 tablet twice a day for 4 weeks for CNE, MC and AD patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Cognitive Tests-Mini Mental Status Examination (MMSE) Score in MC and CNE Groups
outcomeMeasures.description: MMSE is a brief screening instrument used to assess cognitive function in elderly participants. It assesses orientation, memory, attention, ability to name objects, follow verbal and written commands, write a sentence, and copy figures. Total score ranges from 0 to 30, with a lower score indicating greater disease severity.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment.

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - CNE)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for CNE patients

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - MC)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for MC patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Cognitive Tests-Clock Drawing Test Score in MC and CNE Groups
outcomeMeasures.description: Clock drawing test is a visuo-constructive task, where subjects are asked to draw the face of a clock in a pre-drawn circle and then to draw in the arms to denote 16:45 (a quarter to five). The drawing can then be evaluated by a quantitative scoring method, which is based on the degree of completion of the drawing. The scoring system ranges from 0 to 6 with higher scores reflecting a greater number of errors and more impairment.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment.

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - CNE)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for CNE patients

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - MC)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for MC patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Cognitive Tests-Cube Drawing Test Score in MC and CNE Groups
outcomeMeasures.description:
Cube drawing: Subjects are asked to draw a cube by heart. In case of failure, a model of a cube is given to the subjects to copy.

The score system ranges from 0 (worse score) to 6 (best score). Score calculation is following: 1 point by face with 4 sides, 2 points for each face where each angle should be respected.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment.

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - CNE)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for CNE patients

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - MC)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for MC patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Cognitive Tests in MC and CNE Groups - Total Immediate Recall and Delayed Recall Scores of the Free and Cued Selective Reminding Test (FCSRT)
outcomeMeasures.description:
Free and Cued Selective Reminding Test (FCSRT) Assessment of verbal episodic memory. By this test performances in free recalls, cued recalls and in a recognition task can be analysed, because the process of encoding is controlled.

Subjects are asked to remember a list of 16 words. Three tasks of free and cued recalls, as well as one recognition task and one delayed recall give the scores.

Total recall is obtained by the addition of cued recalls to free recalls. Maximum score is 48 for immediate: 16 words X 3 corresponding to immediate free recall + immediate cued recall + immediate recognition test.

Maximum score is 64 (better score) when delayed recall : 16 words X 4 . The minimum score is 0 (worse).
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment.

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - CNE)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for CNE patients

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - MC)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for MC patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Cognitive Tests-Age-Adjusted Logical Memory (MEM III) in MC and CNE Groups
outcomeMeasures.description:
Subjects are asked to memorize two short stories, one consisting of 24, the other one of 26 information units. After the stories have been read aloud by the investigator, subjects are asked to enounce all items of information they can remember (free recall). Correctly reported items are added for each story. This test applies analytical capacities, as well as auditive and verbal synthesis, working memory and episodic memory.

Score range from 0(worst) to 75 (better).
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment.

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - CNE)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for CNE patients

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - MC)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for MC patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Cognitive Tests-Age-Adjusted Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale (WAIS) in MC and CNE Groups
outcomeMeasures.description:
Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale (WAIS) In this test subjects are asked to say how two seemingly dissimilar items might in fact be similar (14 item couples). This test involves especially abstract thinking and concept capacities.

Cognitive Tests-Age-Adjusted Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale (WAIS): 19 tests on similarities. The items 1 to 5 are graded from 1 (good) to 0 (bad), and the items 6 to 19 are graded from 2 (good) to 0 (bad). Item 6 and 7 can be repeated. At the end, the worst total score is 0, the best total score is 33.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment.

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - CNE)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for CNE patients

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - MC)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for MC patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Cognitive Tests-Time to Perform Trail Making Test (TMT) in MC and CNE Groups
outcomeMeasures.description:
TMT is a neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching. The task requires a subject to 'connect-the-dots' of 25 consecutive numbers (1,2,3,etc.) on a sheet of paper or computer screen. The goal of the subject is to finish the test as quickly as possible and the time taken to complete the test is used as the primary performance metric (in seconds). The maximum time allowed is 300 seconds. A negative change score indicates improvement.

First, in the TMT A, the subject has to connect numbers increasingly as fast as possible.

The TMT B requires the subject to connect and letters in an alternating pattern (1-A-2-B-3-C, etc.) in as little time as possible.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment.

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - CNE)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for CNE patients

groups.title: EGb 120 mg (Open Phase - MC)
groups.description: EGb761 120 mg tablet twice a day for 17 months (open phase) for MC patients

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Subjects Conversion to Alzheimer's Dementia Diagnosed According to the DSM IV (Diagnostic of Dementia)
outcomeMeasures.description:
The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders: 4th Edition of the American Psychiatric Association (DSM-IV, 1994) also outlines diagnostic criteria for dementia of the Alzheimer's type that are generally consistent with the NINCDS-ADRDA criteria.

National Institute of Neurological and Communicative Diseases and Stroke / Alzheimer's Disease and Related Disorders Association (NINCDS/ADRDA)
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Subjects Conversion to Alzheimer's Dementia Diagnosed According to NINCDS-ADRDA (Diagnostic of Alzheimer's)
outcomeMeasures.description: The most widely accepted diagnostic criteria for probable AD are those offered by the National Institute of Neurological and Communicative Disorders and Stroke and by the Alzheimer's Disease and Related Disorders Association (NINCDS-ADRDA; McKhann et al., 1984). These criteria include the presence of dementia established by clinical examination and confirmed by neuropsychological testing. The dementia is described as involving multiple, progressive cognitive deficits in older persons in the absence of disturbances of consciousness, presence of psychoactive substances, or any other medical, neurological, or psychiatric conditions that might in and of themselves account for these progressive deficits.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: ITT population. N=Number of subjects with assessment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Adverse Events (AEs)
outcomeMeasures.description:
The relationship of an adverse event to the study medication will be classified according to the following criteria:

Related : reports including good reasons and sufficient information (e.g. temporal relationship, dose-response relationship, pharmacology, positive de-challenge and/or re-challenge) to assume a causal relationship with the study drug in the sense that it is plausible, conceivable, or likely

Not related: reports including good reasons and sufficient information (e.g. no temporal relationship and/or attributable to concurrent disease or other drugs) to rule out a causal relationship with the study drug.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Safety population. CNE patients withdrew during the double-blind phase and were also not included in the safety population for open phase (17 months).

seriousEvents.organSystem: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

explanation_target: Reason: The intervention is EGb761®, a standardized Ginkgo biloba leaf extract used to improve cognition and brain metabolism rather than a monoclonal antibody or a small-molecule anti-amyloid/tau agent. The trial measures change in cerebral glucose metabolism (18F‑FDG PET) and includes cognitive/memory groups, indicating a symptomatic/cognitive enhancement aim rather than a targeted anti‑amyloid or anti‑tau disease‑modifying mechanism. citeturn0search2turn0search6

Act: EGb761 is a phytopharmaceutical (standardized Ginkgo extract containing ~24% flavone glycosides and ~6% terpene lactones) with proposed neuroprotective, antioxidant, and vascular effects and has been studied for symptomatic cognitive improvement in elderly and dementia populations — i.e., a cognitive enhancer/symptomatic treatment. The comparator in the described trial is placebo. citeturn0search0turn0search1

Web search results (supporting sources): EGb 761 overview and composition (PubMed review). citeturn0search2; Pharmacology and clinical use summary (AAFP). citeturn0search1; Review of CNS effects and symptomatic use in dementia (PubMed review). citeturn0search6; Example randomized placebo‑controlled trial showing cognitive effects of EGb761. citeturn0search4

Reflect: Classification as 'Cognitive enhancer' aligns with the drug type (herbal extract used to improve cognitive function/brain metabolism) and the trial endpoints (FDG‑PET change in glucose metabolism, symptomatic follow‑up). There is no indication in the description that EGb761 specifically targets core AD pathology (amyloid or tau) with a biologic or targeted small molecule mechanism, so 'Disease‑targeted biologic' and 'Disease‑targeted small molecule' are not appropriate. No neuropsychiatric‑only endpoint (e.g., agitation) is described, so 'Neuropsychiatric symptom improvement' is not appropriate.
explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational product is EGb761®, a standardized Ginkgo biloba leaf extract used here as a symptomatic/cognitive enhancer (FDG‑PET change and cognitive endpoints). EGb761 has multiple putative actions — antioxidant and neuroprotective effects, vasoactive/vascular effects, platelet‑activating factor antagonism and other pharmacologic activities — rather than a single, specific molecular target such as amyloid‑beta or tau. citeturn0search7turn0search5

Act: Key extracted details: EGb761 is a standardized extract (typical specification ~24% flavone glycosides and ~6% terpene/terpene‑lactones). Preclinical and biochemical work and reviews describe antioxidant and neuroprotective activity, vascular/vasoactive properties, and even some reports of effects on amyloid fibrillization in vitro — i.e., several different biological pathways are implicated rather than one defined CADRO target. Because multiple mechanisms/pathways are indicated, I assign 'R) Multi‑target'. citeturn0search0turn0search4turn0search2

Reflect: This classification aligns with the trial description (symptomatic cognitive enhancement / brain glucose metabolism endpoints rather than a stated single disease‑modifying target) and with the pharmacology of EGb761 which spans oxidative stress, neuroprotection/synaptic support, and vascular effects. If the user prefers a single‑domain mapping (less precise), plausible single CADRO categories would include G) Oxidative Stress, K) Vasculature, or M) Synaptic Plasticity/Neuroprotection — but because the extract acts via several pathways, 'R) Multi‑target' is the most accurate CADRO assignment. citeturn0search7turn0search2

Output: Assigned category — R) Multi-target. Brief rationale: EGb761 is a multi‑component herbal extract with antioxidant, neuroprotective and vascular/vasoactive actions and has been tested as a symptomatic cognitive enhancer; no single, specific CADRO target was specified in the trial description or in primary pharmacologic characterizations, so the multi‑target category is appropriate. citeturn0search5turn0search7

Web search results (supporting sources used): 1) Composition and clinical use of standardized Ginkgo extract (EGb761) — composition/specification and clinical reviews. citeturn0search0turn0search7; 2) Analytical comparisons and standardization of Ginkgo extracts (24% flavone glycosides / 6% terpene trilactones typical for EGb761). citeturn0search4; 3) Study showing EGb761 components and investigation of inhibitory activity toward Aβ fibril formation (preclinical biochemical evidence). citeturn0search2; 4) Trial description listing FDG‑PET brain glucose metabolism endpoint for EGb761 in elderly groups (trial record). citeturn0search5
